radiographic_examinations.findings: The lower chest is within normal limits with no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion. Geographic hypodensities in the liver likely represent focal fatty deposition with no evidence of focal lesions. The pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands are normal. The kidneys are normal in size with no evidence of focal lesions or hydronephrosis. The appendix is dilated and fluid-filled, compatible with acute appendicitis, with small appendicoliths. No free fluid in the pelvis and a physiologic cystic structure in the right adnexa. No lymphadenopathy or vascular abnormalities noted. Sclerotic lesion in the iliac bones likely represents bone islands. Tiny fat containing umbilical hernia.
